intro: Mastixia maingayi, commonly known as the Australian milk tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to northeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal and lowland rainforest habitats, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
